name: Amazon RDS
description: The Sumo Logic App for Amazon RDS provides visibility into your Amazon Relational Database Service (RDS) Metrics collected via a CloudWatch Metrics Source. The Appâ€™s Dashboards provide preconfigured searches and filters that allow you to monitor your RDS system's overview, CPU, memory, storage, network transmit and receive throughput, read and write operations, database connection count, disk queue depth, and more.

children.name: 1. Amazon RDS - Overview
children.description: The Amazon RDS Overview dashboard provides insights into RDS resource statistics and utilization throughout your infrastructure, including CPU, memory, latency, storage, and network throughput.
children.title: 1. Amazon RDS - Overview

panels.title: RDS Performance Insights
panels.text:
- __DBLoad__: The number of active sessions for the DB engine. Typically, you want the data for the average number of active sessions. In Performance Insights, this data is queried as db.load.avg.

   - __DBLoadCPU__: The number of active sessions where the wait event type is CPU. In Performance Insights, this data is queried as db.load.avg, filtered by the wait event type CPU.

   - __DBLoadNonCPU__: The number of active sessions where the wait event type is not CPU.

queries.queryString: Namespace={{namespace}} metric=DBLoad statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace
Namespace={{namespace}} metric=DBLoadCPU statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace
Namespace={{namespace}} metric=DBLoadNonCPU statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace

children.name: 1. Amazon RDS - Overview By Database Instance
children.description: The Amazon RDS Overview By Database Instance dashboard provides insights into resource statistics and utilization per database instance throughout your infrastructure. Panels display data for CPU, memory, latency, storage, and network throughput per database instance.
children.title: 1. Amazon RDS - Overview By Database Instance

queries.queryString:
"\"eventsource\":\"rds.amazonaws.com\"" !errorCode account={{account}} Namespace={{namespace}} region={{region}} sourceIPAddress
| json "eventTime", "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "userAgent", "recipientAccountId", "userIdentity", "requestParameters", "responseElements", "errorCode", "errorMessage",  "requestID", "sourceIPAddress" as eventTime, event_name, event_source, Region, user_agent, accountId1, userIdentity, requestParameters, responseElements, errorCode, errorMessage, requestID, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "rds.amazonaws.com" and !(src_ip matches "*.amazonaws.com") and isEmpty(errorCode)
| json field=userIdentity "accountId", "arn", "userName", "type" as accountId, arn, username, type nodrop
| parse field=arn ":assumed-role/*" as user nodrop  | parse field=arn "arn:aws:iam::*:*" as accountId, user nodrop
| if (isEmpty(errorCode), "Success", "Failure") as eventStatus
| json field=requestParameters "dBInstanceIdentifier", "resourceName", "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier1, resourceName, dBClusterIdentifier1 nodrop
| json field=responseElements "dBInstanceIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier3 nodrop | json field=responseElements "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBClusterIdentifier3 nodrop
| parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*" as f1, dBInstanceIdentifier2 nodrop | parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*" as f1, dBClusterIdentifier2 nodrop
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*", dBInstanceIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBInstanceIdentifier1), dBInstanceIdentifier1, dBInstanceIdentifier3) ) as dBInstanceIdentifier
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*", dBClusterIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBClusterIdentifier1), dBClusterIdentifier1, dBClusterIdentifier3) ) as dBClusterIdentifier
| if (isEmpty(userName), user, userName) as user
| count by src_ip
| lookup latitude, longitude, country_code, country_name, region, city, postal_code from geo://location on ip = src_ip
| where !isnull(latitude)

"\"eventsource\":\"rds.amazonaws.com\"" errorCode account={{account}} Namespace={{namespace}} region={{region}} sourceIPAddress
| json "eventTime", "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "userAgent", "recipientAccountId", "userIdentity", "requestParameters", "responseElements", "errorCode", "errorMessage",  "requestID", "sourceIPAddress" as eventTime, event_name, event_source, Region, user_agent, accountId1, userIdentity, requestParameters, responseElements, errorCode, errorMessage, requestID, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "rds.amazonaws.com" and !(src_ip matches "*.amazonaws.com") and !isEmpty(errorCode)
| json field=userIdentity "accountId", "arn", "userName", "type" as accountId, arn, username, type nodrop
| parse field=arn ":assumed-role/*" as user nodrop  | parse field=arn "arn:aws:iam::*:*" as accountId, user nodrop
| if (isEmpty(errorCode), "Success", "Failure") as eventStatus
| json field=requestParameters "dBInstanceIdentifier", "resourceName", "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier1, resourceName, dBClusterIdentifier1 nodrop
| json field=responseElements "dBInstanceIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier3 nodrop | json field=responseElements "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBClusterIdentifier3 nodrop
| parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*" as f1, dBInstanceIdentifier2 nodrop | parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*" as f1, dBClusterIdentifier2 nodrop
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*", dBInstanceIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBInstanceIdentifier1), dBInstanceIdentifier1, dBInstanceIdentifier3) ) as dBInstanceIdentifier
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*", dBClusterIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBClusterIdentifier1), dBClusterIdentifier1, dBClusterIdentifier3) ) as dBClusterIdentifier
| if (isEmpty(userName), user, userName) as user
| count by src_ip
| lookup latitude, longitude, country_code, country_name, region, city, postal_code from geo://location on ip = src_ip
| where !isnull(latitude)

"\"eventsource\":\"rds.amazonaws.com\"" account={{account}} Namespace={{namespace}} region={{region}}
| json "eventTime", "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "userAgent", "recipientAccountId", "userIdentity", "requestParameters", "responseElements", "errorCode", "errorMessage",  "requestID", "sourceIPAddress" as eventTime, event_name, event_source, Region, user_agent, accountId1, userIdentity, requestParameters, responseElements, errorCode, errorMessage, requestID, src_ip nodrop 
| where event_source = "rds.amazonaws.com"
| json field=userIdentity "accountId", "arn", "userName", "type" as accountId, arn, username, type nodrop
| parse field=arn ":assumed-role/*" as user nodrop  | parse field=arn "arn:aws:iam::*:*" as accountId, user nodrop
| json field=requestParameters "dBInstanceIdentifier", "resourceName", "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier1, resourceName, dBClusterIdentifier1 nodrop
| json field=responseElements "dBInstanceIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier3 nodrop | json field=responseElements "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBClusterIdentifier3 nodrop
| parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*" as f1, dBInstanceIdentifier2 nodrop | parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*" as f1, dBClusterIdentifier2 nodrop
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*", dBInstanceIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBInstanceIdentifier1), dBInstanceIdentifier1, dBInstanceIdentifier3) ) as dBInstanceIdentifier
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*", dBClusterIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBClusterIdentifier1), dBClusterIdentifier1, dBClusterIdentifier3) ) as dBClusterIdentifier
| if (isEmpty(errorCode), "Success", "Failure") as eventStatus
| if (isEmpty(userName), user, userName) as user
| count by eventStatus
| sort by _count, eventStatus asc

"\"eventsource\":\"rds.amazonaws.com\"" errorCode account={{account}} Namespace={{namespace}} region={{region}}
| json "eventTime", "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "userAgent", "recipientAccountId", "userIdentity", "requestParameters", "responseElements", "errorCode", "errorMessage",  "requestID", "sourceIPAddress" as eventTime, event_name, event_source, Region, user_agent, accountId1, userIdentity, requestParameters, responseElements, errorCode, errorMessage, requestID, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "rds.amazonaws.com" and !isEmpty(errorCode)
| json field=userIdentity "accountId", "arn", "userName", "type" as accountId, arn, username, type nodrop
| parse field=arn ":assumed-role/*" as user nodrop  | parse field=arn "arn:aws:iam::*:*" as accountId, user nodrop
| if (isEmpty(errorCode), "Success", "Failure") as eventStatus
| json field=requestParameters "dBInstanceIdentifier", "resourceName", "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier1, resourceName, dBClusterIdentifier1 nodrop
| json field=responseElements "dBInstanceIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier3 nodrop | json field=responseElements "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBClusterIdentifier3 nodrop
| parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*" as f1, dBInstanceIdentifier2 nodrop | parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*" as f1, dBClusterIdentifier2 nodrop

| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*", dBClusterIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBClusterIdentifier1), dBClusterIdentifier1, dBClusterIdentifier3) ) as dBClusterIdentifier
| count as Frequency by errorCode

"\"eventsource\":\"rds.amazonaws.com\"" account={{account}} Namespace={{namespace}} region={{region}}
| json "eventTime", "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "userAgent", "recipientAccountId", "userIdentity", "requestParameters", "responseElements", "errorCode", "errorMessage",  "requestID", "sourceIPAddress" as eventTime, event_name, event_source, Region, user_agent, accountId1, userIdentity, requestParameters, responseElements, errorCode, errorMessage, requestID, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "rds.amazonaws.com"
| json field=userIdentity "accountId", "arn", "userName", "type" as accountId, arn, username, type nodrop
| parse field=arn ":assumed-role/*" as user nodrop  | parse field=arn "arn:aws:iam::*:*" as accountId, user nodrop
| if (isEmpty(errorCode), "Success", "Failure") as eventStatus
| if (isEmpty(userName), user, userName) as user
| json field=requestParameters "dBInstanceIdentifier", "resourceName", "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier1, resourceName, dBClusterIdentifier1 nodrop
| json field=responseElements "dBInstanceIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier3 nodrop | json field=responseElements "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBClusterIdentifier3 nodrop
| parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*" as f1, dBInstanceIdentifier2 nodrop | parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*" as f1, dBClusterIdentifier2 nodrop
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*", dBInstanceIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBInstanceIdentifier1), dBInstanceIdentifier1, dBInstanceIdentifier3) ) as dBInstanceIdentifier
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*", dBClusterIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBClusterIdentifier1), dBClusterIdentifier1, dBClusterIdentifier3) ) as dBClusterIdentifier
| timeslice 15m
| count by _timeslice, eventStatus
| fillmissing timeslice(15m), values ("Success", "Failure") in eventStatus
| transpose row _timeslice column eventStatus

"\"eventsource\":\"rds.amazonaws.com\"" errorCode account={{account}} Namespace={{namespace}} region={{region}}
| json "eventTime", "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "userAgent", "recipientAccountId", "userIdentity", "requestParameters", "responseElements", "errorCode", "errorMessage",  "requestID", "sourceIPAddress" as eventTime, event_name, event_source, Region, user_agent, accountId1, userIdentity, requestParameters, responseElements, errorCode, errorMessage, requestID, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "rds.amazonaws.com" and !isEmpty(errorCode)
| json field=userIdentity "accountId", "arn", "userName", "type" as accountId, arn, username, type nodrop
| parse field=arn ":assumed-role/*" as user nodrop  | parse field=arn "arn:aws:iam::*:*" as accountId, user nodrop
| if (isEmpty(errorCode), "Success", "Failure") as eventStatus
| json field=requestParameters "dBInstanceIdentifier", "resourceName", "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier1, resourceName, dBClusterIdentifier1 nodrop

| parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*" as f1, dBInstanceIdentifier2 nodrop | parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*" as f1, dBClusterIdentifier2 nodrop
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*", dBInstanceIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBInstanceIdentifier1), dBInstanceIdentifier1, dBInstanceIdentifier3) ) as dBInstanceIdentifier
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*", dBClusterIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBClusterIdentifier1), dBClusterIdentifier1, dBClusterIdentifier3) ) as dBClusterIdentifier
| if (isEmpty(userName), user, userName) as user

| json "eventTime", "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "userAgent", "recipientAccountId", "userIdentity", "requestParameters", "responseElements", "errorCode", "errorMessage",  "requestID", "sourceIPAddress" as eventTime, event_name, event_source, Region, user_agent, accountId1, userIdentity, requestParameters, responseElements, errorCode, errorMessage, requestID, src_ip nodrop

| if (isEmpty(errorCode), "Success", "Failure") as eventStatus

panels.title: Database Events from Known Malicious IP Addresses

queries.queryString:
"\"eventsource\":\"rds.amazonaws.com\"" account={{account}} Namespace={{namespace}} region={{region}}
| json "eventTime", "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "userAgent", "recipientAccountId", "userIdentity", "requestParameters", "responseElements", "errorCode", "errorMessage",  "requestID", "sourceIPAddress" as eventTime, event_name, event_source, Region, user_agent, accountId1, userIdentity, requestParameters, responseElements, errorCode, errorMessage, requestID, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "rds.amazonaws.com"
| json field=userIdentity "accountId", "arn", "userName", "type" as accountId, arn, username, type nodrop
| parse field=arn ":assumed-role/*" as user nodrop  | parse field=arn "arn:aws:iam::*:*" as accountId, user nodrop
| if (isEmpty(errorCode), "Success", "Failure") as eventStatus
| json field=requestParameters "dBInstanceIdentifier", "resourceName", "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier1, resourceName, dBClusterIdentifier1 nodrop
| json field=responseElements "dBInstanceIdentifier" as dBInstanceIdentifier3 nodrop | json field=responseElements "dBClusterIdentifier" as dBClusterIdentifier3 nodrop
| parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*" as f1, dBInstanceIdentifier2 nodrop | parse field=resourceName "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*" as f1, dBClusterIdentifier2 nodrop
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:db:*", dBInstanceIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBInstanceIdentifier1), dBInstanceIdentifier1, dBInstanceIdentifier3) ) as dBInstanceIdentifier
| if (resourceName matches "arn:aws:rds:*:cluster:*", dBClusterIdentifier2, if (!isEmpty(dBClusterIdentifier1), dBClusterIdentifier1, dBClusterIdentifier3) ) as dBClusterIdentifier
| count by src_ip, event_name, user, user_agent
| lookup type, actor, raw, threatlevel as malicious_confidence from sumo://threat/cs on threat=src_ip 
| json field=raw "labels[*].name" as label_name 
| replace(label_name, "\\/","->") as label_name
| replace(label_name, "\""," ") as label_name
| where  type="ip_address" and malicious_confidence = "high"
| if (isEmpty(actor), "Unassigned", actor) as Actor
| sort by _count
| fields src_ip, event_name, user, user_agent, type, actor, malicious_confidence

children.name: 2. Amazon RDS - Performance Insights
children.description: The Amazon RDS Performance Insights dashboard provides intuitive performance data from throughout your RDS infrastructure across CPU load, non CPU load, active sessions, and performance trends.
children.title: 2. Amazon RDS - Performance Insights

queries.queryString: Namespace={{namespace}} metric=DBLoad statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg
Namespace={{namespace}} metric=DBLoadCPU statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg
Namespace={{namespace}} metric=DBLoadNonCPU statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg

panels.title: RDS Performance Insights
panels.text:
- __DBLoad__: The number of active sessions for the DB engine. Typically, you want the data for the average number of active sessions. In Performance Insights, this data is queried as db.load.avg.

   - __DBLoadCPU__: The number of active sessions where the wait event type is CPU. In Performance Insights, this data is queried as db.load.avg, filtered by the wait event type CPU.

   - __DBLoadNonCPU__: The number of active sessions where the wait event type is not CPU.
   
To enable Performance Insight on database instance read AWS document at https://docs.aws.amazon.com/AmazonRDS/latest/UserGuide/USER_PerfInsights.Enabling.html

queries.queryString: Namespace={{namespace}} metric=DBLoad statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace
Namespace={{namespace}} metric=DBLoadCPU statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace
Namespace={{namespace}} metric=DBLoadNonCPU statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace

queries.queryString:
"\"eventSource\":\"rds.amazonaws.com\"" *DBInstance* !Describe*DBInstance* !StartDBInstance !StopDBInstance !RebootDBInstance account={{account}} Namespace={{namespace}} region={{region}}
| json "eventTime", "eventName", "eventSource", "awsRegion", "userAgent", "recipientAccountId", "userIdentity", "requestParameters", "responseElements", "errorCode", "errorMessage",  "requestID", "sourceIPAddress" as eventTime, event_name, event_source, Region, user_agent, accountId1, userIdentity, requestParameters, responseElements, errorCode, errorMessage, requestID, src_ip nodrop
| where event_source = "rds.amazonaws.com" and event_name matches "*DBInstance*" and !(event_name matches "Describe*DBInstance*") and !(event_name in ("StartDBInstance", "StopDBInstance", "RebootDBInstance"))
| json field=userIdentity "accountId", "arn", "userName", "type" as accountId, arn, username, type nodrop
| parse field=arn ":assumed-role/*" as user nodrop | parse field=arn "arn:aws:iam::*:*" as accountId, user nodrop
| json field=requestParameters "engine", "dBInstanceClass", "dBClusterIdentifier", "dBInstanceIdentifier", "dBSnapshotIdentifier" as engine1, dBInstanceClass1, dBClusterIdentifier1, dBInstanceIdentifier1, dBSnapshotIdentifier nodrop  
| json field=responseElements "dBName", "engine", "dBInstanceClass", "dBClusterIdentifier", "dBInstanceIdentifier" as dbName, engine2, dBInstanceClass2, dBClusterIdentifier2, dBInstanceIdentifier2 nodrop

| if (!isEmpty(dBClusterIdentifier1), dBClusterIdentifier1, dBClusterIdentifier) as dBClusterIdentifier
| if (isEmpty(errorCode), "Success", "Failure") as eventStatus
| if (isEmpty(userName), user, userName) as user

| sort by eventCount, event_name asc

children.name: 4. Amazon RDS - Aurora MySQL
children.description: The Amazon RDS Aurora MySQL dashboard provides intuitive Aurora MySQL performance data from across your infrastructure for latency, throughput, active and blocked transactions, queries, login failures, and replica lag.
children.title: 4. Amazon RDS - Aurora MySQL

Namespace={{namespace}} metric=InsertThroughput statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace

children.name: 5. Amazon RDS - Aurora MySQL Global Database and Backtrack Activity
children.description: The Amazon RDS Aurora MySQL Global Database and BackTrack Activity dashboard provides insights into Aurora MySQL performance data from across your infrastructure for Global Database activity and Backtrack activity.
children.title: 5. Amazon RDS - Aurora MySQL Global Database and Backtrack Activity

panels.title: Backtrack Change Records Creation Rate

queries.queryString: Namespace={{namespace}} metric=BacktrackChangeRecordsCreationRate statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace

panels.description: The number of backtrack change records created over five minutes for your DB cluster.

panels.title: Backtrack Change Records Stored

queries.queryString: Namespace={{namespace}} metric=BacktrackChangeRecordsStored statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace

panels.description: The actual number of backtrack change records used by your DB cluster.

panels.title: Backtrack Window Actual

queries.queryString: Namespace={{namespace}} metric=BacktrackWindowActual statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace

panels.description: The difference between the target backtrack window and the actual backtrack window.

panels.title: Backtrack Window Alert

queries.queryString: Namespace={{namespace}} metric=BacktrackWindowAlert statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace

panels.description: The number of times that the actual backtrack window is smaller than the target backtrack window for a given period of time.

panels.title: Aurora Global DB Replicated Write IO

queries.queryString: Namespace={{namespace}} metric=AuroraGlobalDBReplicatedWriteIO statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace

panels.description: In an Aurora Global Database, the number of write I/O operations replicated from the primary AWS Region to the cluster volume in a secondary AWS Region. The billing calculations for the secondary AWS Regions in a global database use VolumeWriteIOPS to account for writes performed within the cluster. The billing calculations for the primary AWS Region in a global database use VolumeWriteIOPS to account for the write activity within that cluster, and AuroraGlobalDBReplicatedWriteIO to account for cross-region replication within the global database.

panels.title: Aurora Global DB Data Transfer Bytes

queries.queryString: Namespace={{namespace}} metric=AuroraGlobalDBDataTransferBytes statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace

panels.description: In an Aurora Global Database, the amount of redo log data transferred from the master AWS Region to a secondary AWS Region.

panels.title: Aurora Global DB Replication Lag

queries.queryString: Namespace={{namespace}} metric=AuroraGlobalDBReplicationLag statistic=average account={{account}} region={{region}} dbidentifier={{dbidentifier}} | avg by dbidentifier, account, region, namespace

panels.description: For an Aurora Global Database, the amount of lag when replicating updates from the primary AWS Region, in milliseconds.
